Patient presents for a follow up on psoriasis , getting worse since spreading , currently using at home UV . Exa- enter [ EXAMINATION ] Symmetrically distributed red plaques with well-defined edges and white silvery scale located on arms , legs , and trunk . Patient declines systemic therapy at this time . Start Veta , apply once daily to affected areas . Continue with home UV treatments . Acne will go . Management options were discussed including extractions , topicals , acne wash and oral medication . Risks and benefits of each reviewed . Patient opted to proceed with the following treatment . Start benazepril peroxide wash [ period ] Recommended
  begin over-the-counter Bentyl , paroxetine cleanser , Pinoxol 10% , acne wash b.i.d. Avoid getting cleanser into ice inside nose or mouth . Long hand after using cleanser . Advised patient that BP all made bleach , hair or fabrics . Use carefully , avoid contact with clothing , hair , and surroundings . Follow up after three months for follow up
